Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Part 1: Normative Rules Analysis - Sequence must be: Application Received Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision Inform Applicant [If Approved: Finalize Documentation] Close Case - Specific constraints: 1. Credit Check before Risk Assessment 2. Risk Assessment before Loan Decision 3. Inform Applicant after Loan Decision 4. If Approved: Finalize Documentation before Close Case 5. If Rejected: NO Finalize Documentation before Close Case

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 1 Analysis: - 0900 Application Received - 0930 Credit Check - 1000 Risk Assessment - 1100 Loan Decision (Approved) - 1300 Inform Applicant - 1330 Finalize Documentation - 1400 Close Case - Check: Sequence is correct. Approved path includes Finalize Documentation before Close Case. No violations.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - NE
Text: Case 2 Analysis: - 0800 Application Received - 0820 Risk Assessment - VIOLATION: Credit Check must occur before Risk Assessment. Here Credit Check happens at 0900, which is after Risk Assessment. - 0900 Credit Check - 0930 Loan Decision (Rejected) - 1000 Finalize Documentation - VIOLATION: For rejected loans, documentation should NOT be finalized. - 1030 Close Case - So Case 2 has two normative violations: wrong order (Risk before Credit) and finalizing documentation after rejection.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3 Analysis: - 0900 Application Received - 2024-01-14 1000 Credit Check (2 days later) - 1100 Risk Assessment - 1200 Loan Decision (Approved) - 2024-01-16 1500 Inform Applicant (2 days later) - 2024-01-17 0900 Finalize Documentation - 1000 Close Case - No Follow-up Call - Sequence check: Application Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision Inform Applicant Finalize Close Case. This is correct. - Approved path: Has Finalize Documentation before Close Case. Correct. - So no normative violations.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Part 2: Desiderata Analysis - Credit Check within 24 hours of Application Received - Inform Applicant within 48 hours of Loan Decision - Follow-up Call encouraged (not strictly required) before closing case

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 1: - Application: 0900 Jan 10, Credit Check: 0930 Jan 10 (30 minutes later - within 24h) - Loan Decision: 1100 Jan 10, Inform Applicant: 1300 Jan 10 (2 hours later - within 48h) - Follow-up Call: Not mentioned (optional anyway)

Name: Deductive Reasoning - NE
Text: Case 2: Desiderata are recommended but not strict, but since there are already normative violations, I should mention desiderata violations too if they exist, but the focus is on the serious violations first. - Application: 0800 Jan 11, Credit Check: 0900 Jan 11 (1 hour later - within 24h) - but this is after the normative violation, so the timing is fine but the order is wrong. - Loan Decision: 0930, Inform Applicant: 1000 (30 mins later - within 48h) - Follow-up Call: Not mentioned.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3: - Application: 0900 Jan 12, Credit Check: 1000 Jan 14 (2 days + 1 hour = 49+ hours later? Lets calculate) - Jan 12 0900 to Jan 13 0900 = 24h - Jan 13 0900 to Jan 14 0900 = 24h - Jan 14 0900 to Jan 14 1000 = 1h - Total: 49 hours. This is > 24 hours. VIOLATION of desiderata: Credit Check took longer than recommended 24 hours. - Loan Decision: 1200 Jan 14, Inform Applicant: 1500 Jan 16 - Jan 14 1200 to Jan 15 1200 = 24h - Jan 15 1200 to Jan 16 1200 = 24h - Jan 16 1200 to Jan 16 1500 = 3h - Total: 51 hours. This is > 48 hours. VIOLATION of desiderata: Inform Applicant took longer than recommended 48 hours after decision. - Follow-up Call: Not present. VIOLATION of desiderata: Missing recommended call.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Summary: - Case 1: No normative violations. No desiderata violations. - Case 2: Normative violations (order: Risk before Credit; finalizing docs after rejection). - Case 3: No normative violations. Desiderata violations (Credit Check timing, Inform timing, missing Follow-up Call).

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Task 3: Interpretations/Justifications - Case 2: Could be manual error, system glitch, or perhaps a parallel processing attempt that went wrong. Finalizing documentation after rejection could be a system error where the rejected status wasnt properly recorded, or perhaps someone started finalizing before the decision was updated in the system. - Case 3: Delays could be due to high workload, applicant unavailability, system downtime, or holidays/weekends (though the dates suggest weekdays). Missing follow-up call could be oversight or deemed unnecessary due to clear written communication.

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Let me double-check the dates for Case 3: - Jan 12 is Friday (assuming 2024) [...] - So yes, Jan 13-14 is weekend. That explains the delay in Credit Check (Saturday/Sunday). This is a good justification for the desideratum violation. - For the Inform Applicant delay (Jan 14 to Jan 16): Jan 14 is Sunday, decision at 1200. 48 hours later would be Tuesday 1200. They informed at 1500 on Tuesday, so thats 3 hours over. This could be due to applicant unavailability or end-of-day processing.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Final check: Are there any normative violations in Case 3 I missed? - Sequence: App -> Credit -> Risk -> Decision -> Inform -> Finalize -> Close. Yes, correct. - Approved path has Finalize. Yes. - No Follow-up Call is not normative, its desiderata. All good.
